memberdef.name: MAX_PATHS
memberdef.initializer: 500 /* Max allowed active paths at any time */

memberdef.argsstring: (ps_lattice_t *dag, ps_latnode_t *from, ps_latnode_t *to, int32 score, int32 ef)
memberdef.name: ps_lattice_link

briefdescription.para: Create a directed link between "from" and "to" nodes, but if a link already exists, choose one with the best link_scr.
Insert penalty for fillers.
Remove nodes marked as unreachable.
Write a lattice to disk.

simplesect.para: 0 for success, <0 on failure.

briefdescription.para: Write a lattice to disk in HTK format.

simplesect.para: 0 for success, <0 on failure.

briefdescription.para: Read a lattice from a file on disk.

parameterdescription.para: Decoder to use for processing this lattice, or NULL.

simplesect.para: Newly created lattice, or NULL for failure.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of frames in the lattice.

simplesect.para: Number of frames in this lattice.

briefdescription.para: Construct an empty word graph with reference to a search structure.
Retain a lattice.

detaileddescription.para: This function retains ownership of a lattice for the caller, preventing it from being freed automatically. You must call ps_lattice_free() to free it after having called this function.

simplesect.para: pointer to the retained lattice.

briefdescription.para: Free a lattice.

simplesect.para: new reference count (0 if dag was freed)

briefdescription.para: Get the log-math computation object for this lattice.

simplesect.para: The log-math object for this lattice. The lattice retains ownership of this pointer, so you should not attempt to free it manually. Use logmath_retain() if you wish to reuse it elsewhere.

briefdescription.para: Start iterating over nodes in the lattice.

simplesect.para: No particular order of traversal is guaranteed, and you should not depend on this.
Iterator over lattice nodes.

briefdescription.para: Move to next node in iteration.

simplesect.para: Updated node iterator, or NULL if finished

briefdescription.para: Stop iterating over nodes.
Get node from iterator.
Get start and end time range for a node.

parameterdescription.para: Output: End frame of first exit from this node.
Output: End frame of last exit from this node.

simplesect.para: Start frame for all edges exiting this node.

briefdescription.para: Get word string for this node.

simplesect.para: Word string for this node (possibly a pronunciation variant).

briefdescription.para: Get base word string for this node.

simplesect.para: Base word string for this node.

briefdescription.para: Get best posterior probability and associated acoustic score from a lattice node.

parameterdescription.para: Output: exit link with highest posterior probability

simplesect.para: Posterior probability of the best link exiting this node. Log is expressed in the log-base used in the decoder. To convert to linear floating-point, use logmath_exp(ps_lattice_get_logmath(), pprob).

briefdescription.para: Iterate over exits from this node.

simplesect.para: Iterator over exit links from this node.

briefdescription.para: Iterate over entries to this node.

simplesect.para: Iterator over entry links to this node.

briefdescription.para: Get next link from a lattice link iterator.

simplesect.para: Updated iterator, or NULL if finished.

briefdescription.para: Stop iterating over links.
Get link from iterator.
Get start and end times from a lattice link.

simplesect.para: these are inclusive - i.e. the last frame of this word is ef, not ef-1.

parameterdescription.para: Output: (optional) start frame of this link.

simplesect.para: End frame of this link.

briefdescription.para: Get destination and source nodes from a lattice link.

simplesect.para: destination node

briefdescription.para: Get word string from a lattice link.

simplesect.para: Word string for this link (possibly a pronunciation variant).

briefdescription.para: Get base word string from a lattice link.

simplesect.para: Base word string for this link

briefdescription.para: Get predecessor link in best path.

simplesect.para: Best previous link from bestpath search, if any. Otherwise NULL

briefdescription.para: Get acoustic score and posterior probability from a lattice link.

simplesect.para: Posterior probability for this link. Log is expressed in the log-base used in the decoder. To convert to linear floating-point, use logmath_exp(ps_lattice_get_logmath(), pprob).

briefdescription.para: Get hypothesis string after bestpath search.
Get hypothesis segmentation iterator after bestpath search.
Create a new lattice link element.
Add an edge to the traversal queue.
Remove an edge from the traversal queue.
Clear and reset the traversal queue.
Start a forward traversal of edges in a word graph.

simplesect.para: A keen eye will notice an inconsistency in this API versus other types of iterators in PocketSphinx. The reason for this is that the traversal algorithm is much more efficient when it is able to modify the lattice structure. Therefore, to avoid giving the impression that multiple traversals are possible at once, no separate iterator structure is provided.
First link in traversal.

briefdescription.para: Get the next link in forward traversal.

simplesect.para: Next link in traversal.

briefdescription.para: Start a reverse traversal of edges in a word graph.

simplesect.para: See ps_lattice_traverse_edges() for why this API is the way it is.
First link in traversal.

briefdescription.para: Get the next link in reverse traversal.

simplesect.para: Next link in traversal.

briefdescription.para: Do N-Gram based best-path search on a word graph.

detaileddescription.para: This function calculates both the best path as well as the forward probability used in confidence estimation.

simplesect.para: Final link in best path, NULL on error.

briefdescription.para: Calculate link posterior probabilities on a word graph.

detaileddescription.para: This function assumes that bestpath search has already been done.

simplesect.para: Posterior probability of the utterance as a whole.

briefdescription.para: Prune all links (and associated nodes) below a certain posterior probability.

detaileddescription.para: This function assumes that ps_lattice_posterior() has already been called.

parameterdescription.para: Minimum posterior probability for links. This is expressed in the log-base used in the decoder. To convert from linear floating-point, use logmath_log(ps_lattice_get_logmath(), prob).

simplesect.para: number of arcs removed.

memberdef.argsstring: (ps_lattice_t *dag, ngram_model_t *lmset, float32 lwf, int sf, int ef, int w1, int w2)
memberdef.name: ps_astar_start

briefdescription.para: Begin N-Gram based A* search on a word graph.

parameterdescription.para: Ending frame for N-best search, or -1 for last frame.
First context word, or -1 for none.
Second context word, or -1 for none.

simplesect.para: 0 for success, <0 on error.

briefdescription.para: Find next best hypothesis of A* on a word graph.

simplesect.para: a complete path, or NULL if no more hypotheses exist.

briefdescription.para: Get hypothesis string from A* search.
Get hypothesis segmentation from A* search.
Finish N-best search, releasing resources associated with it.
Word graph search.
